text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Sohag Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Governadorat de Suhaj.png | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Emblem Sohag Governorate.svg | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Sohag in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Sohag Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Sohag (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 1,547 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 5063000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = }} Sohag Governorate is a governorate of Egypt. Since 1960, its capital has been the city of Sohag. Prior to that, the capital was the city of Girga and the name of the governorate was Girga Governorate. ==Cities and towns== * Akhmim * Dar El Salam * El Balyana * El Mansha * El Maragha * El Usayrat * Girga * Juhayna * Sakulta * Sohag * Tahta * Tima ==Important sites== * Abydos El Balyana * Apollonos Polis * Beit Khallaf * El Hawawish * El Salamuni * Gabal El Haridi * Hut-Repyt * Kom Ishqaw * Tjebu * Red Monastery * White Monastery ==References== Category:Governorates of Egypt
title: Sohag Governorate
